creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Marilyn Tupper Doe
description: wide road lined with old-fashioned buildings and trees growing at a diagonal over the road; trees wrapped in bamboo fencing; a tree with white blossoms URQ; small crowds of people on road
dimension:
10 1/4 × 9 5/8 in. (26.04 × 24.45 cm) (sight)
36 7/8 × 34 3/4 × 1 1/4 in. (93.66 × 88.27 × 3.18 cm) (outer frame, framed with others: see notes)
medium: Color woodblock print: ink and colors on paper
title: Twelve Months of Kyoto (Arashiyama park, a famous scenic resort)
